meanings.definition: Suggesting or implying something without explicitly stating it.
meanings.sent1: Her implicative smile hinted at her true feelings.
meanings.sent2: The implicative tone of his voice made me suspicious.
meanings.sent3: The implicative look she gave me made me wonder what she was thinking.
meanings.sent4: His implicative gestures revealed more than his words ever could.
meanings.sent5: The implicative nature of her actions left me guessing.

meanings.definition: Involving or indicating a logical relationship between two propositions.
meanings.sent1: The implicative nature of the argument made it clear which side was correct.
meanings.sent2: His implicative reasoning led to a breakthrough in the case.
meanings.sent3: The implicative connection between the evidence and the suspect was undeniable.
meanings.sent4: The implicative link between the two theories shed light on the mystery.
meanings.sent5: Her implicative analysis of the data revealed a surprising conclusion.
